pullRequest.body:
We show that if `X` is an object in a Galois category, then there exists an object `A` and a point `a` in the fiber of `A` such that `A` is Galois and that the evaluation map at `a` from `A âŸ¶ X` to the fiber of `X` is bijective.

This is the main input in the pro-representability of fiber functors.

---

Do we have an entry for this in `docs/references.bib`? If not, please add it.
And refer to it here please.
Please check if this is what you meant, I am not sure I interpreted the instructions in `docs/references.bib` correctly.
What does `fiso` stand for?
Nothing :D I changed the docstring to make it clearer.

```suggestion
lemma exists_hom_from_galois_of_fiber (X : C) (x : F.obj X) :
```

```suggestion
lemma exists_hom_from_galois_of_fiber_nonempty (X : C) (h : Nonempty (F.obj X)) :
```

```suggestion
lemma exists_hom_from_galois_of_connected (X : C) [IsConnected X] :
```

```suggestion

```
